intro: Verbesina chiapensis, commonly known as Chiapan goldenrod, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, seed-filled capsules as fruits. Verbesina chiapensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
